title: Betrothal with borrowed ring
vignette: A man gives a ring borrowed from the bride herself to effect kiddushin.

options.text: Invalid unless she gifts the ring first.
Valid if she knowingly accepts it.

title: Betrothal via messenger
vignette: The groom sends an agent with money and words of betrothal instead of going himself.

options.text: Agency works; they are betrothed.
Only personal delivery forms a bond.

title: Conditional kiddushin on wealth
vignette: He says: be betrothed to me on condition I am wealthy, though he isn't.

options.text: Void if the condition proves false.
Still valid once she accepts.

title: Betrothing an underage girl
vignette: A father marries off his young daughter before she reaches maturity.

options.text: Permitted with the father's consent.
Wrong; wait until she is grown.

title: Stolen money for kiddushin
vignette: The groom secretly uses stolen cash to betroth a woman.

options.text: Invalid until he returns the theft and uses his own.
Still effective despite the sin.

title: Father accepts kiddushin without daughter's consent
vignette: The father agrees to the match though his adult daughter objects.

options.text: Her consent is required; betrothal fails.
His parental authority suffices.

title: Worthless item as betrothal money
vignette: He gives her a token worth less than a perutah when saying the formula.

options.text: Not valid; value must meet the minimum.
Value doesn't matter if she agrees.

title: Delayed effect kiddushin
vignette: He says she will be betrothed to him after thirty days and she accepts now.

options.text: It takes effect after the set time.
It is immediate regardless of delay.

title: Second man betroths during waiting period
vignette: Before the thirty days pass, another suitor betroths her with her consent.

options.text: The second kiddushin prevails.
The first man's claim stands until the time passes.

title: Using a forgiven loan as consideration
vignette: The groom says the money she owes him is now for kiddushin instead of repayment.

options.text: Not valid; a loan cannot serve as the money.
Valid if she agrees to that arrangement.

title: Proxy delivering the ring
vignette: Both sides send representatives to enact the kiddushin with a ring.

options.text: Agents may perform all parts for them.
At least one party must be present.

title: Woman betrothing a man
vignette: She hands him money saying "Be my husband".

options.text: Does not take effect; only men betroth.
Valid if he accepts.

title: Non-observant ring
vignette: The ring used for kiddushin was made from idolatrous imagery.

options.text: Unfit; select a different ring.
It still works despite its origin.

title: Betrothal through teaching core law
vignette: Instead of money, he offers to teach her core law as consideration for marriage.

options.text: Knowledge cannot substitute for money or item.
If she values it, the kiddushin is valid.

title: Reusing a ring from a broken engagement
vignette: He had previously betrothed another woman with this ring but the engagement was canceled.

options.text: He may reuse it without issue.
It carries bad associations; choose a new ring.
